article_title: Obamacare Insured Worse Off Than Uninsured

article_metadata.author: The Apothecary

og.description: 45 million Americans under 65 years old reported they were in families with problems paying medical bills in 2015. In 2011, the number was 57 million. That drop of 12 million corresponds with a significant increase in health insurance coverage. Remarkably, those who remained uninsured account for the biggest share of the decrease in the number of Americans with troubles paying medical bills.
og.title: Trouble Paying Medical Bills: Obamacare Insured Worse Off Than Uninsured
